title: Lists
content:
Service Management uses predefined lists in the application forms. You can add more items and build new customized lists to meet the requirements of your environment.

Lists are categorized into system-defined and user-defined.

  • System-defined lists are locked. You cannot add, edit or delete any of the list items.
  • User-defined lists are unlocked by default allowing you to add and edit the list items but you cannot delete them.

Although system-defined lists are locked, they can still be customized to align with specific customer needs and preferences.

The following table summarizes the actions you can perform on these lists:

Action

System-defined/locked lists

User-defined/unlocked lists

Edit list name (display name)

No

Yes

Delete list

No

Yes

Edit list item name

Yes

Yes

Add list item

No

Yes

Delete list item

You can delete any item while adding it to the list if you no longer need it. After you save the list, you cannot delete its items.

No

No

User-defined lists are categorized into volatile or non-volatile. Both these lists types are tailored to specific preferences and share the characteristics of unlocked lists.

The following table highlights the key differences between these two types of lists:

Volatile lists
 Non-volatile lists

Created when defining a user option inside an Offering or Model.

In Administration > Configuration > Lists, the User options list icon   appears next to volatile lists. If you want to create volatile list, go to Plan > Service Catalog > Offerings tab. Select an existing offering or create a new one and click User Options. If the Field type of the offering is List/Multi select list it allows you to create a new list or you can select any of the pre-defined lists.

 Created in Administration > Configuration > Lists.

Can be reused when defining a new user option of type List/Multi-Select List in other offerings or models but not for a field of type ENUM/ENUM SET defined in a record type.

 Can be reused when defining a new user option of type List/Multi-Select List in other offerings or models as well as for a field of type ENUM/ENUM SET defined in a record type.
There is no limit on how many lists can be created. There is a limit of 200 user-defined lists of this type.
Can include up to 300 items.

You can include up to 300 items in a list. The Data domains list is an exception and it can include up to 1000 items.
Can be ordered alphabetically or ordinally (user-defined order). Order is automatically ordinal (user-defined).
Included in the catalog data transferred by the Package Manager, if referenced in the catalog data
  • Included in the configuration data transferred by the Package Manager.
  • Included in the catalog data transferred by the Package Manager, if referenced in the catalog data.

Cannot be deleted.
  • System-defined lists cannot be deleted.
  • User-defined lists can be deleted before they are referenced by any record type defined in Studio or by a user option.
 For development and production tenants, all configuration changes must be made on the development tenant. For details, see Dev2Prod - Synchronize your development and production tenants topic.

Create list

  1. From the main menu, go to Administration > Configuration > Lists.

  2. In the Lists pane on the left, click Add.

  3. Enter a name and a display name. To enter the display name in multiple languages, click the ellipsis button  .

  4. Click Ok.

  5. Click Add to add list items. The Add list item pop-up appears.
    1. Enter the name and display name for the list item. To enter the display name in multiple languages, click the relevant Display name field and type the display name into the appropriate language field.
    2. (Optional) Select an icon for the list item.
    3. Select the position for the item in the list.
    4. Click Ok.
      After you define the item's position in the list, you cannot change the it.

  6. Click Save.

For all customized lists, the list name and the names of the list items must end with _c. This suffix is added automatically. You can add up to 300 list items (including disabled items) to a list. When this limit is reached, the Add button in the List items area is disabled.

    Edit list

    1. From the main menu, go to Administration > Configuration > Lists.

    2. In the Lists pane on the left, select the list that you want to edit.

       To search for a particular list, enter the name, or part thereof, in the Search box.

    3. In the right pane, edit the display name.

      To edit a list item:

      1. Click the relevant display name to define the display name in multiple languages.

      2. Click Edit to select an icon.

      3. Clear the Active check box to disable an item.

        You can disable only customized Enum values. Disabled values become unavailable when creating or updating a record. They appear with a strikethrough and remain usable in business rules and filters. 
    4. Click Save.
      For system-defined lists, you can edit only the display name. You can discard changes, but you cannot delete or change the position of items in the list.

    If Person Status is empty or null, notifications are not sent to that person. You can add a custom value (for example, External Consultant / Non-Employee) to the Person Status list and use that value instead of keeping the Active field empty to send notifications. 

    Create or edit list in User Options tab

    1. Go to the User options tab in an offering, change model, incident model, or release model record.

    2. To create a new user option of type list, click New field. Enter a name and a display name and select List as the field type from the drop-down list.

    3. In the List field, select an existing list from the drop-down list or click Add to define a new list. Enter a name and display name for the new list and click OK.

    4. In the List order field, select one of the following options:

      • Alphabetical: The application sorts the list items alphabetically.

      • Ordinal: The application sorts the list items based on the user-defined order.

      If you select a non-volatile list in the List field, the List order field becomes unavailable.

    5. If the selected list is editable, in the List Items area, click Add to add list items:

      1. Enter the name and display name for the list item.

      2. If the list order is ordinal, select the position for the item in the list.

        After you define the item's position in the list, you cannot change the position.

      3. Click OK or Add another.

    6. If there are Enum values in the selected list, in the List Items area, you can clear the Active check box to disable the value.

       The disabled values become unavailable when creating or updating a record and displayed with strikethrough and can be used in business rules.
    7. Click Save on the toolbar.  
    For all customized lists, the list name and the names of the list items must end with _c. This suffix is added automatically. You can add up to 300 list items to a user options list. When this limit is reached, the Add button in the List items area is disabled.

    Search for list

    1. From the main menu, go to Administration > Configuration > Lists.
    2. The Lists panel on the left displays all the system and user-defined lists.
    3. Type full or partial search criteria to narrow the list of results. For example, type Change. To define cascading lists, see Define suggested values by a list-to-list mapping section under Field Selection Rule Examples topic.
